data.title: The Mark of the Beast (1980)
data.meta_description: In 1928 in the northern part of the Netherlands, a man has an affair with the wife of one of his friends (who is in jail at the time). Because she abandons her children to move in with him, the police are sent to arrest her. This leads to a dramatic confrontation.
data.text:
The fact this film doesn't have a review on here shows how deep the ghetto of Dutch cinema can be.

In short, twice Golden Calf award winning film from 1980, is a period-drama masterpiece. It covers a true event from the late 1920s, when an anarchist and highly-skilled brickwork pointer enters a relationship with the wife of a friend who abandons her children in the process.

The affair leads to a dramatic and terrible conclusion.

pardon the clich√©, but every frame looks like a classic Dutch painting, the story is compelling, well told, and the cast are excellent. Wonderful film.
